title: Advanced Button - Usage Examples
description: Common usage patterns and example configurations for the Advanced Button block

examples.name: Primary CTA Button - Gradient Background
examples.description: Eye-catching call-to-action button with gradient background, icon, and hover effects
examples.visualDescription: Purple-to-blue gradient background (135deg), white text, 16px padding, right arrow icon, smooth color transition on hover to darker gradient, subtle shadow, center aligned
examples.useCase: Hero sections, landing pages, primary conversion actions, signup forms
examples.responsiveNotes: Padding and font size reduce on mobile for better tap targets

examples.name: Outline Button with Border and Hover Fill
examples.description: Minimal outline button that fills with color on hover
examples.visualDescription: Transparent background, 2px solid purple border, purple text, rounded corners. On hover: fills with purple gradient, text turns white, border remains
examples.useCase: Secondary actions, 'learn more' links, less prominent CTAs, supporting buttons next to primary buttons
examples.responsiveNotes: Works well at all screen sizes, no breakpoint adjustments needed

examples.name: Icon Button - Circular Play Button
examples.description: Circular button with large FontAwesome icon, perfect for video/media controls
examples.visualDescription: 60px × 60px circular button, white background, purple play icon (24px), purple border. On hover: purple background, white icon, shadow appears
examples.useCase: Video players, media controls, hero video overlays, icon-only action buttons
examples.responsiveNotes: Icon size and padding reduce on mobile for better proportions
examples.accessibilityNotes: ariaLabel is critical for icon-only buttons - screen readers need text description

examples.name: Button with Hover Text Change (style-7)
examples.description: Button text changes on hover, revealing alternative message
examples.visualDescription: 'Download Now' changes to 'Free PDF Guide' on hover. Teal background, white text, arrow icon that slides in from left on hover
examples.useCase: Downloads, revealing additional info on hover, interactive CTAs, teasers
warnings: style-7 is specifically designed for hover text changes - don't use other styleType values if you want this effect
hoverText is required when using style-7, otherwise hover state will be empty
On mobile/touch devices, hover text change doesn't work well - consider using standard button instead

examples.name: FancyBox Video Popup Button
examples.description: Opens YouTube/Vimeo video in lightbox popup overlay
examples.visualDescription: Red 'Watch Video' button with play icon. Clicking opens video in centered modal with dark overlay (80% opacity black)
examples.useCase: Video demonstrations, testimonial videos, tutorial links, product showcases, YouTube/Vimeo embeds
warnings: fancyBox: true is required to enable popup functionality
btnLink.url must be a valid YouTube, Vimeo, or direct video URL
fancWidth unit should be 'px' for desktop, '%' for responsive (sm/xs)
Video popups don't work well on mobile networks - consider direct links instead

validationRules.fancyBox: Must be true to enable popup
validationRules.btnLink.url: Required - must be valid video URL (YouTube/Vimeo) or iframe content
validationRules.fancWidth: Optional - controls popup width, defaults to auto if not set

examples.name: Full-Width Responsive Button with Shake Animation
examples.description: Full-width button on mobile, auto-width on desktop, with shake animation to draw attention
examples.visualDescription: Dark blue button, full-width on mobile (xs), auto-width centered on desktop. Shakes gently every 5 seconds to grab attention. White text, right chevron icon
examples.useCase: Urgent CTAs, limited-time offers, checkout buttons, mobile-first designs, attention-grabbing actions
examples.responsiveNotes: btnWidth changes from auto (desktop/tablet) to 100% (mobile) for full-width mobile buttons. Padding reduces on mobile for better proportion.
warnings: shakeAnimate should be used sparingly - too many shaking elements create visual chaos
shakeDuration in seconds - animation repeats every N seconds (5s is recommended)
Don't use shake animation on critical navigation or accessibility-focused elements

examples.name: Ghost Button - Minimal with Hover Shadow Effect
examples.description: Transparent button with text only, shadow grows on hover for subtle depth
examples.visualDescription: No background, no border, just purple text. On hover: subtle shadow appears beneath button creating floating effect, text darkens slightly
examples.useCase: Tertiary actions, 'read more' links, minimal designs, text-heavy layouts, blog post links
examples.responsiveNotes: Works well at all screen sizes without adjustments
warnings: Ghost buttons have low visibility - don't use for primary CTAs
Ensure sufficient color contrast for accessibility (WCAG AA: 4.5:1 minimum)
Test on various backgrounds to ensure button text is readable

examples.name: Advanced: Style-23 with Tag Hint Text
examples.description: Button with additional tag/hint text displayed separately (style-23 specific feature)
examples.visualDescription: Main button text 'Premium Plan' with smaller '$29/mo' tag text below in lighter color. Green background, white main text, light green tag text
examples.useCase: Pricing tables, plan selection, buttons with additional context (price, date, label), multi-line button content
warnings: btnTagText only appears when styleType is exactly 'style-23' - won't work with other styles
tagTyp typography is separate from texTyp - must configure both for proper styling
Tag text appears below main text - ensure button has enough height (increase padding if needed)

validationRules.styleType: Must be 'style-23' for tag text to display
validationRules.btnTagText: Required when using style-23, otherwise tag area will be empty
validationRules.tagTyp: Should be configured separately from texTyp for proper tag styling

relatedPatterns: Pricing cards with plan selection buttons

responsive_full_width_mobile.description: Button auto-width on desktop, full-width on mobile

gradient_hover_transition.description: Smooth gradient transition on hover (lighter to darker)

outline_to_filled_hover.description: Outline button that fills with color on hover

circular_icon_button.description: Perfect circle button with icon only

validationRules.block_id: Required - unique identifier for the button block
validationRules.styleType: Required - determines button layout and behavior (style-1 to style-23)
validationRules.btnText: Required for most styles - main button text (can be empty for icon-only buttons)
validationRules.hoverText: Only used with style-7 - text that replaces btnText on hover
validationRules.btnTagText: Only used with style-23 - additional tag/hint text below main text
validationRules.fancyBox: Set to true for video/iframe popup functionality
validationRules.fontAwesomeIcon: Required when iconType is 'fontAwesome' - icon class name
validationRules.ariaLabel: Recommended for icon-only buttons - accessibility label for screen readers
validationRules.btnWidth: Optional - max width of button (use % for responsive, px for fixed)

warnings: Never modify block_id after button creation - breaks references and functionality
styleType changes completely alter button structure - don't change styleType on existing buttons without reviewing all attributes
hoverText only works with style-7 - will be ignored on other styleType values
btnTagText only works with style-23 - configure tagTyp separately from texTyp
fancyBox requires valid video URL (YouTube/Vimeo) or iframe content in btnLink.url
Icon-only buttons (empty btnText) must have ariaLabel for accessibility
shakeAnimate should be used sparingly - multiple shaking elements create visual chaos
Some style types have specific attribute requirements - check plugin documentation for advanced styles
Gradient backgrounds require openBg: 1 and bgType: 'gradient' in normalBG/hoverBG
Border radius in % creates perfect circles only with equal padding - use px for custom rounded corners
Box shadows with large blur values can impact performance on low-end devices
commonMistakes: Forgetting to set openTypography: 1 in texTyp before customizing font properties
Using hoverText with styleType other than 'style-7' (won't display)
Setting btnTagText without changing styleType to 'style-23' (tag won't appear)
Creating icon-only button without ariaLabel (accessibility issue)
Setting fancyBox: true without valid video URL (popup fails to open)
Using px units for btnWidth on mobile (should use % or responsive values)
Not configuring hover states (normalBG set but hoverBG missing - no hover effect)
Setting openBg: 0 but defining bgDefaultColor (background won't display)
Forgetting to enable openBorder: 1 in bgNormalB/bgHoverB before setting border properties
Using shake animation on critical UI elements (navigation, accessibility controls)
Setting border radius to 50% without equal padding (creates oval instead of circle)
bestPractices: Always configure both normal and hover states for consistent UX
Use responsive values (md/sm/xs) for padding and font size to optimize for all devices
Include ariaLabel for all icon-only buttons for screen reader accessibility
Test buttons on high-contrast modes - ensure sufficient color contrast (WCAG AA: 4.5:1)
Use style-1 for most use cases - it's the most flexible and widely supported
Keep btnWidth auto or % for responsive layouts - avoid fixed px widths
Limit shake animations to 1-2 per page maximum for best UX
Use outline buttons (transparent bg + border) for secondary actions next to primary CTAs
Configure hover shadows to be slightly larger than normal shadows for depth effect
For gradient buttons, use similar hue families for smooth visual transitions
Always test fancyBox popups on mobile networks - consider direct links as fallback

responsiveStrategy.description: Button adapts to screen sizes using md (desktop), sm (tablet), xs (mobile) breakpoints
responsiveStrategy.recommendedApproach: Configure md first (desktop), then override sm/xs only where needed. If sm/xs are empty, they inherit from md.
commonResponsivePatterns: Reduce padding on mobile for better tap targets: md: 16px → xs: 12px
Reduce font size on mobile: md: 16px → xs: 14px
Full-width buttons on mobile: btnWidth md: 'auto' → xs: '100%'
Smaller icons on mobile: iconSize md: 18px → xs: 14px
Center alignment on mobile even if left-aligned on desktop

accessibilityNotes: Icon-only buttons require ariaLabel for screen readers to understand button purpose
Ensure color contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1 between text and background (WCAG AA)
Hover-only effects (like hoverText in style-7) don't work on touch devices - provide alternative
Button target size should be at least 44×44px for touch accessibility (adjust padding accordingly)
Use semantic link vs button: use <a> for navigation (external links), <button> for actions (forms, toggles)
Test with keyboard navigation: buttons should be focusable and activatable via Enter/Space keys
Avoid relying solely on color to convey information (e.g., red = error) - use text/icons too

styleTypeReference.description: Quick reference for button styleType variations

styles.style-1: Standard button - most versatile, supports all features
styles.style-23: Tag/hint text button (requires btnTagText and tagTyp)

styleTypeReference.note: Most projects use style-1 (90% of use cases). Advanced styles require specific attributes and may not support all features.
